PEPFAR/Swaziland intends to enter into a Fixed Amount Award (FAA) with the Institute for Health Management Southern Africa (IHM) for technical services aimed at improving the health information system (HIS) in Swaziland. The grant will support the Government of the Kingdom of Swaziland (GOKS) in its planned national roll-out and scale-up of a Client Management Information System (CMIS). The grant covers specialized technical assistance to the Ministry of Health (MOH) Strategic Information Department (SID) for the development of new software, user guides and the related standard operating procedures (SOPs) and reports. The award also covers: annual preparation of five national and regional HIV/TB program reports; completion of a rapid analysis of sexual networks of adolescent girls and young women (AGYW); the geospatial analysis and mapping of HIV program coverage with a special focus on women and adolescents; and Improved data collection and monitoring of the Swaziland HIV/AIDS Program Monitoring System (SHAPMoS) by the Swaziland National Emergency Response Council on HIV/AIDS (NERCHA).
Purpose: There are three main overarching objectives of this award: 1) scale up the CMIS currently successfully piloted in 3 HMIS sites to 134 number of sites nationwide; 2) support improved data for decision-making by the MOH SID and PEPFAR/Swaziland by facilitating continuous data quality monitoring and reports for key HIV/AIDS and other demographic indicators including geospatial mapping; and 3) generate baseline and longitudinal data related to AGYW in PEPFAR assisted DREAMS regions to document the effectiveness of these new specially targeted AGYW interventions.
